final_answer.precision_note: Given data are 3 s.f., so report concentration to 3 s.f.

method: Use the dilution relationship c1V1 = c2V2. Here c1 = 0.200 mol dm-3 and V1 = 25.0 cm3 are diluted to V2 = 250.0 cm3. Because both volumes are in the same units (cm3), their ratio can be used directly: c2 = c1×(V1/V2) = 0.200×(25.0/250.0) = 0.200×0.100 = 0.0200 mol dm-3.
checks: A 10× increase in volume should give a 10× lower concentration; 0.200/10 = 0.0200.
